Posted By: VirusVescichetta (10/12/2012 7:51:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm having a hard time deciding weather or not I should put this in a 3cmc slot over [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk) in my B/G aggro deck. Nighthawk's Flying + Lifelink make it a fantastic beatstick, especially with [Rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rancor); the Flying + Deathtouch makes it a great defender.  
  
But the Haste + 3/3 + split color cost makes me think, 'This just beats face better.' Plus, it's Scavenge ability gives 3 +1/+1's at 5 mana; while not a game-ender on-par with [Wolfir Silverheart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wolfir Silverheart) in and of its own, it is a great mid-late game boost to, say, [Champion of Lambholt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Champion of Lambholt). [Corpsejack Menace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpsejack Menace) in the mix would be just gravy. Eat him with a [Lotleth Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotleth Troll), and it's sitting in the graveyard for later use (if you need it).  
  
Plus...he's a Zombie. And my [Gravecrawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravecrawler)s loooooove other Zombies.  
  
I'm going to have to give the slot to Dreg Mangler, at least in this set-up
posts.html:
I'm having a hard time deciding weather or not I should put this in a 3cmc slot over Vampire Nighthawk in my B/G aggro deck. Nighthawk's Flying + Lifelink make it a fantastic beatstick, especially with Rancor; the Flying + Deathtouch makes it a great defender.

But the Haste + 3/3 + split color cost makes me think, 'This just beats face better.' Plus, it's Scavenge ability gives 3 +1/+1's at 5 mana; while not a game-ender on-par with Wolfir Silverheart in and of its own, it is a great mid-late game boost to, say, Champion of Lambholt. Corpsejack Menace in the mix would be just gravy. Eat him with a Lotleth Troll, and it's sitting in the graveyard for later use (if you need it).

Plus...he's a Zombie. And my Gravecrawlers loooooove other Zombies.

I'm going to have to give the slot to Dreg Mangler, at least in this set-up

Posted By: audiojunki (12/26/2012 2:17:36 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I run four of these in my standard Golgari Zombies deck. They are an absolute powerhouse. Being able to pump out an extra three unexpected damage when my opponent's creatures are all tapped has won me many a game, and he's excellent food for [Lotleth Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotleth Troll) if you plan on going into the late game. It gets even better when you scavenge those three extra +1/+1 counters onto the already trampling Troll, or onto anything with [Rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rancor).
posts.html:

Posted By: Sign_in_Blood (11/15/2012 8:31:10 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ RAV0004  
  
It's not the fact that he has haste (black has several creatures with haste - it's haste in GREEN that is unusual for the color pie.)  
  
My guess is the amount you get for the mana. Most 3 CMC haste creatures have a P under 3, those that don't are uncommon or even rare in extreme cases. in addition, he has no drawback. A 3/3 for 3 is a decent common. A 3/3 haste is a boring uncommon. a 3 CMC 3/3 Zombie with haste with a decent second ability is getting an awful lot for your money. Consider he would easily be rare and very fun if he was a 4/3.
posts.html:
@ RAV0004

It's not the fact that he has haste (black has several creatures with haste - it's haste in GREEN that is unusual for the color pie.)

My guess is the amount you get for the mana. Most 3 CMC haste creatures have a P under 3, those that don't are uncommon or even rare in extreme cases. in addition, he has no drawback.
